metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15219 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.1.8. There is a NULLpointer dereference caused by a malicious USB device in thedrivers/usb/misc/sisusbvga/sisusb.c driver.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-157.185
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1052.59
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1090.101
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1056.61
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1041.43
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1117-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1117.126
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1121.127
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-157.185').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1052.59').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.101').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1117.126').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.127').
